titlestmt.titleproper: A Finding Aid to the Millicent Rogers Museum Records, 1983-1984, in the Archives of American Art
titlestmt.author: Ricky Gomez

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on 2023-04-06 17:26:40 -0400.

change.item: EAD 2002 finding aid created from MARC record import.

did.abstract: The records of the Millicent Roger Museum measure 0.2 linear feet and date from 1983 to 1984. The records consist of two letters, one to and one from Arthur H. Wolf, the museum director, regarding the Hispanic Artists Registry; the registry of Hispanic artists and craftsmen in New Mexico, consisting of questionnaires completed by each artist; magazine and newspaper articles about the registry and about Millicent Rogers.

bioghist.head: Biographical / Historical
bioghist.p: Millicent Rogers Museum is located in Taos, New Mexico, and it was founded in 1956 by Paul Peralta-Ramos. The museum was established as a museum in memory of his mother, Millicent Rogers. The museum collects and exhibits art and artifacts related to the Southwest.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: The collection is arranged into one series.

list.item: Series 1: Millicent Rogers Museum Records, 1983-1984 (0.2 linear feet; Box 1)

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: The records of the Millicent Roger Museum measure 0.2 linear feet and date from 1983 to 1984. The records consist of two letters, one to and one from Arthur Wolf, the museum director, regarding the Hispanic Artists Registry; the registry of Hispanic artists and craftsmen in New Mexico, consisting of questionnaires completed by each artist; magazine and newspaper articles about the registry and about Millicent Rogers.

userestrict.head: Conditions Governing Use
userestrict.p: The Archives of American Art makes its archival collections available for non-commercial, educational and personal use unless restricted by copyright and/or donor restrictions, including but not limited to access and publication restrictions. AAA makes no representations concerning such rights and restrictions and it is the user's responsibility to determine whether rights or restrictions exist and to obtain any necessary permission to access, use, reproduce and publish the collections. Please refer to the Smithsonian's Terms of Use for additional information.

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: This collection is open for research. Access to original papers requires an appointment and is limited to the Archives' Washington, D.C. Research Center.

acqinfo.head: Immediate Source of Acquisition
acqinfo.p: Donated July 1984 by Millicent Rogers Museum through the director Arthur Wolf. Microfilmed as part of AAA's Texas Arts Documentation Project.

altformavail.head: Existence and Location of Copies
altformavail.p: 35mm microfilm reel 3431 available for use at the Archives' Washington, D.C. Research Center and the Museum of Fine Arts, Houston.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Millicent Rogers Museum Records, 1983-1984. Archives of American Art, Smithsonian Institution.

processinfo.head: Processing Information
processinfo.p: The collection was processed, and a finding aid prepared by Ricky Gomez in 2022.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: The records of the Millicent Roger Museum measure 0.2 linear feet and date from 1983 to 1984. The records consist of two letters, one to and one from Arthur Wolf, the museum director, regarding the Hispanic Artists Registry; the registry of Hispanic artists and craftsmen in New Mexico, consisting of questionnaires completed by each artist; magazine and newspaper articles about the registry and about Millicent Rogers.
